result.execSummary:
The defendant William James Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William James Lewis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William James Lewis was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant William James Lewis in court in custody from DC Jail.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen in court for William James Lewis. V. Girard - Clerk 
Atty Lundeen - There is an agreement in this case, will waive the prelim & proceed today - the Jt recommendation is He will plea to Ct 1 & Ct 2 will be dismissed.  18 MO IC & 18 MO ES
  21 days credit not including today
State - that is correct - concurrent to any other sentence currently serving, asking for AODA & CC
Deft - agrees  - will waive prelim
Court finds waiver of prelim voluntarily & knowingly
All parties agree not asking for PSI

Atty Lundeen - recd information, waive reading
Deft - enters NC plea to Ct 1, waives rights & JT
Parties stip that facts support the plea

Court - finds plea & waiver made knowingly & voluntarily, finds factual basis & approves stip by parties
  Accepts plea to Ct 1 and finds deft guilty as a repeater
   Orders 1 yr 6 mo IC & 1 yr 6 mo ES concurrent to DC case 2020CF45 or any other sentence currently serving
   Is not eligible for CIP but is eligible for SAP,  orders $268 CC + $250 DNA + $20 crime stopper = 538 - 60 dtp or pp,
   Prison wages may be garnished from prison fund up to statutory amount of 50%,  Submit a DNA sample when go back down to jail.
   Follow all rules & programming recommended by agent.  

Ct 2 dismissed
Not be in presence of drug para or controlled substance without valid prescription.

1:24 PM Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant William James Lewis appeared by video in custody from Dunn County jail. Attorney Jonathan Lundeen appears by Zoom.  B. Bahr - Clerk 
Atty Lundeen - rcvd complaint waive reading. 
State - $300 cash bond. Not be in presence of drug para or controlled substance without valid prescription.
Atty Lundeen - argues for sign bond. DE is on Probation hold.
Court - orders $250 cash bond. Not be in presence of drug para or controlled substance without valid prescription.
Atty Lundeen - requests speedy prelim.
Court - sets speedy prelim in Branch 1.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
